most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Authentication Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulty linking accounts (Google, GitHub) and logging in after Pieces OS updates. Issues include infinite loading on authentication page, 500 errors for /os/sign_in, and single account linking limitations.  Solutions involve Pieces support manually merging accounts, resetting account data, and deploying authentication service updates.  Check support logs for additional troubleshooting.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* John encountered issues with account linking, specifically the inability to link his personal domain to his GitHub account.
* This was due to a known bug in the old authentication service and possibly a case sensitivity issue with email addresses.

**Problems Identified:**

* The current account linking process is not functioning properly.
* The old authentication service is causing problems.
* There might be a case sensitivity issue with email addresses.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark, a support member, offered to manually merge accounts and guide John through the process.
* A temporary fix was attempted by resetting John's GitHub account.
* A new authentication service is being developed and is expected to be ready in March.
* Mark offered to re-engage with John once the new system is available.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* John successfully linked his accounts using the new authentication app but in the wrong order.
* He needs his accounts reset so he can re-link them correctly.
* Mark offered to schedule a time to resolve the issue.

**Additional Notes:**

* The case sensitivity issue with email addresses needs further investigation.
* The new authentication service is expected to resolve account linking problems.

**Overall, the issue has not been fully resolved, but a solution is on the horizon with the new authentication service. In the meantime, Mark is available to help John manually.**

related_issues.title: Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
related_issues.text:
Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After updating pieces to latest version, I was loggged out (This was part of the update, which I saw in the update / release notes.). But when I try to log in, always end up at https://authentication.pieces.services/ without moving forward. that page keep loading and nothing happens.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Authentication Issue with PiecesOS 11.3.0

### Key Points Raised

* Users are unable to link Google accounts after the PiecesOS update to version 11.3.0. 
* Authentication via https://authentication.pieces.services is stuck in an infinite loading loop. 
* Problem occurs on Windows 11 and affects attempted logins from both PiecesDesktop app and toolbar.

### Problems Identified

* Bug in authentication flow after update to PiecesOS 11.3.0
* Manually refreshing the "https://authentication.pieces.services/" page can cause callback issues with local application flow.

### Proposed/Implemented Solutions

* Pieces team investigated the reported issues and identified the source of the bug.
* A fix was implemented and deployed within a few hours of identification.

### Current Status/Outcome

* Authentication issue resolved. Users are able to link their Google accounts and successfully login.

### Additional Information

* Users experiencing further issues are advised to check their local support logs and contact Pieces support.

related_issues.title: OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
related_issues.text:
OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I try to log in via PFD, the spinner loads indefinitely before opening an error page in the browser:

https://pieces.app/authentication-error?sentry_id=00000000000000000000000000000000&os=bb009f04-7e79-44cb-8376-aba647cd2c98&platform=linux

In the OS logs (Documents/com.pieces.os/Support/logs) I see this entry:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
```

It is surrounded by HTTP 200s like this:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:53.075570  0:00:00.000685 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.038635  0:00:00.001700 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.043187  0:00:00.000732 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.335453  0:00:00.001876 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:56.077590  0:00:00.000695 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:59.079649  0:00:00.000662 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.081551  0:00:00.000486 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.272493  0:00:00.001839 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.334258  0:00:00.000938 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.457128  0:00:00.001378 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:05.083569  0:00:00.000541 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.085902  0:00:00.000518 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.094713  0:00:00.001812 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
```
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

- @utrack is experiencing authentication issues on Linux.
- @nathan-courtney-pieces requests log files and Linux OS information.
- @utrack provides log files and confirms they are using Arch Linux.

**Problems Identified:**

- Authentication error on Linux for @utrack.
- Lack of details in log files provided by @utrack.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- @nathan-courtney-pieces requests complete log files and OS information.
- @utrack provides the requested information.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- Investigation ongoing. 

**Additional Notes:**

- The conversation appears to be ongoing at the time of this summary.
- No definitive solution has been identified yet.

**Missing Information:**

- It is unclear whether @utrack enabled debug logging as requested.
- The outcome of the investigation is not yet known.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS startup and login issues across platforms
common_issues.description: Users reported startup failures due to invalid ports, database corruption, and login errors on Windows and Linux. Solutions included verifying admin privileges during installation, using WinGet, addressing CPU compatibility, and ongoing investigation for login issues on Linux.

related_issues.title: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest from 17032025 (can't find it)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi I am stuck at the initial stages. Where the desktop app is being initialized. I am at verify dependency connections and it says unable to open pieces core services. "FormatException: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect.

It might be an antivirus stopping it. I am not sure. But I have restarted and reinstalled to no effect.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

### Key Points Raised

* **SherlockSol** reported an issue with Pieces Desktop not launching, experiencing an "Invalid Port" error.
* **nathan-courtney-pieces** requested log files and additional information about the user's hardware and Windows build number.
* **SherlockSol** provided the requested information and confirmed their Windows build number as 22631.
* **mack-at-pieces** suggested a video call to troubleshoot the issue live as they were unable to reproduce it.
* **uzaxirr** reported facing the same issue.
* **zedevmed** identified the problem as the lack of admin privileges during installation, leading to port binding issues.
* **zedevmed** suggested using WinGet in an elevated PowerShell session to resolve the issue.
* **tsavo-at-pieces** acknowledged the solution and planned to adjust the documentation accordingly.
* **mack-at-pieces** thanked zedevmed for their contribution and offered further assistance if needed.

### Problems Identified

* Pieces Desktop not launching due to an "Invalid Port" error.
* Difficulty in reproducing the issue by the Pieces team.
* Lack of admin privileges during installation causing port binding issues.

### Solutions Proposed/Implemented

* Requesting log files and hardware information from the user.
* Scheduling a video call for live troubleshooting.
* Utilizing WinGet in an elevated PowerShell session for installation.
* Adjusting the documentation to promote the proper installation methods.

### Current Status/Outcome

* The issue is identified and a solution is proposed.
* Further communication and potential troubleshooting are planned with the affected users.
* Documentation updates are pending to reflect the recommended installation methods.

Overall, the issue seems to be resolved with the proposed solution. However, further communication and potential troubleshooting are needed to ensure a definitive outcome.

### Checked for Existing Issues?

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The latest version doesn't start. 

Here is the log in com.pieces.os/production/Support/logs:

[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.605235  Starting OS_Server!
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.605235  Starting EnvConf
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.605235  Starting DeploymentInfo
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  Number: 218
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  Tag: 11.3.0
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  Branch: 11.3.0
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  SHA1: a59a1f114c021e83a6f42e696223dba9a670faa2
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  WinDeployType: exe
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  Channel : production
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  Process ID: 2076
[D]  Setting Url Protocol Scheme for Inno Setup/ Squirrel Installs
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.625235  Logging to file: C:\Users\antoine\Documents\com.pieces.os\production\Support/logs/log-04122025.txt
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.634236  Copying the vocab file to the data directory
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.634236  Successfully copied the vocab file
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.634236  Starting OS
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.660235  Starting OS
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.660235  Starting UI
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.665241  UI#builder, hasData: false, hasError: false
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.665241  stateStream#onListen
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.665241  OS#boot
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.665241  OS#attach
[38;5;12m[I][0m  initializeDataSingletons
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.991237  Created our Tagify Files Locally.
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.991237  User added tagify files now exist.
[D]  Setting WinToast Dismissed Callback
[D]  Setting WinToast Dismissed Callback
[D]  Sentry Error Event: 1ba7ab308a4b470ab996b360cc956398
[38;5;12m[I][0m  _controller.addError Unable to open database due to corruption LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #0      InternalCouchBaseDatabases.initializeCouchbase (package:database_facade/couchbase/singletons/internal_databases.dart)
<asynchronous suspension>
#1      OS.initializeDataSingletons (package:os_server/os.dart:909)
<asynchronous suspension>
#2      OS.boot (package:os_server/os.dart:652)
<asynchronous suspension>
#3      OS._controller.<anonymous closure>.<anonymous closure>.<anonymous closure> (package:os_server/os.dart:275)
<asynchronous suspension>

[D]  Sentry Error Event: 2a48d07355694369b880fa84ef743112
[D]  Sentry Error Event: 9f79ad8b81a1493c955f24b3cf97db7e
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:05.956756  UI#builder, hasData: false, hasError: true
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: timeout
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: Notification Timeout: Went into side panel
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: timeout
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: Notification Timeout: Went into side panel
## Summary of GitHub Issue #686

**Problem:**

* Initial boot-up issue in the database.
* User is unable to launch Pieces OS, even after reinstalling and deleting the database folder.

**Proposed Solution:**

* Debugging in real-time to identify the cause of the problem.
* Providing additional logging in the next release to gather more information.

**Implemented Solution:**

* Investigating the issue and identifying two root causes:
    * Missing `com.pieces.os\production\Pieces\couchbase.cblite2` folder due to a faulty installation process.
    * User's CPU lacking AVX2 support, which is required for CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension used by Pieces OS.
* Pushing a fix in version 11.3.2 to address both issues.

**Current Status:**

* Issue resolved with the release of version 11.3.2.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user provided valuable information about their specific hardware limitations, which helped diagnose the issue.
* The issue was not reproducible by the support team due to the specific combination of factors involved.

**Key Takeaways:**

* Importance of providing detailed information to help diagnose and solve problems.
* Collaboration between users and support team can lead to effective solutions.

### Your Pieces OS Version

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I try to log in via PFD, the spinner loads indefinitely before opening an error page in the browser:

https://pieces.app/authentication-error?sentry_id=00000000000000000000000000000000&os=bb009f04-7e79-44cb-8376-aba647cd2c98&platform=linux

In the OS logs (Documents/com.pieces.os/Support/logs) I see this entry:

[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Crash on Startup - Windows and macOS
common_issues.description: Pieces OS crashes on startup for Windows and macOS users.  Issues include native_extensions_plugin.dll crash, database corruption preventing launch, and general startup crashes after updates. Solutions include disabling the problematic plugin, reinstalling, updating to the latest Pieces OS version (11.3.2 or higher), and checking system compatibility (AVX2 support for Windows).

related_issues.title: Crash due to native_extensions_plugin.dll
related_issues.text:
Crash due to native_extensions_plugin.dll
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS crashes. I’ve reinstalled the program, turned off the antivirus and firewall, updated the graphics driver, but nothing helps, it crashes consistently.
Windows 10, 64 bit, i3-12100F, RAM: 32 Gb, GTX 950.
If there's no solution, how can I disable this plugin so that it simply doesn't crash?

**Key Points Raised:**

**Problems Identified:**

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- The issue has been acknowledged and is being investigated.

**Additional Notes:**

- The provided links to related issues and resources may offer further insights into the problem.

Windows

11.3.0

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

## Summary of GitHub Issue #686

**Problem:**

* Initial boot-up issue in the database.
* User is unable to launch Pieces OS, even after reinstalling and deleting the database folder.

**Proposed Solution:**

* Debugging in real-time to identify the cause of the problem.
* Providing additional logging in the next release to gather more information.

**Implemented Solution:**

* Investigating the issue and identifying two root causes:
    * Missing `com.pieces.os\production\Pieces\couchbase.cblite2` folder due to a faulty installation process.
    * User's CPU lacking AVX2 support, which is required for CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension used by Pieces OS.
* Pushing a fix in version 11.3.2 to address both issues.

**Current Status:**

* Issue resolved with the release of version 11.3.2.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user provided valuable information about their specific hardware limitations, which helped diagnose the issue.
* The issue was not reproducible by the support team due to the specific combination of factors involved.

**Key Takeaways:**

* Importance of providing detailed information to help diagnose and solve problems.
* Collaboration between users and support team can lead to effective solutions.

Application Crash on Startup
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Upon launching the application, it crashes immediately with an error message stating "Unexpected error occurred." This issue started occurring after updating to version 11.0.0. The crash seems to be related to the new plugin integration. Steps to reproduce:


## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation "Pieces App Crashing on macOS 12.3"

**Problem:**
- The Pieces app crashes when launched on macOS 12.3, despite working fine on previous version 10.9.5.

**Key points:**
- User provided detailed information about their operating system, hardware, installed plugins, and crash logs.
- User confirmed the problem was not the same as another reported issue.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**
- Support agent recommended checking a similar existing issue and suggested scheduling a support call.
- After investigation, the issue was identified as being resolved in the latest version 11.3.2.

**Current status/outcome:**
- The user is advised to update to version 11.3.2 and reopen the ticket if the issue persists.

**Additional notes:**
- The user's contribution helped identify and resolve the issue, improving the experience for other users.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Startup Crash Due to Database Corruption
common_issues.description: Pieces OS fails to start on macOS and Windows due to database corruption.  Error: "LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized."  Issue linked to faulty installation, missing Couchbase files, and CPU lacking AVX2 support.  Updating to latest version (11.3.2) or reinstalling might resolve the issue. Further debugging and logs are crucial for diagnosis.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Early Access Program

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS fails to start because it is unable to open the database due to corruption. The error message displayed is: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.

Steps to Reproduce:

Attempt to start Pieces OS on macOS.
Observe the error message indicating database corruption.
Expected Behavior: I expected Pieces OS to start normally and access the database without any issues.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* User @moazzem-pixel created an issue regarding a database corruption problem preventing Pieces OS from starting.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces OS is unable to start due to a corrupted database.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces Support Bot suggests related issues and resources.
* @mark-at-pieces identifies the issue as a duplicate and recommends continuing the conversation in a different thread.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The conversation has been moved to a previously existing issue thread focusing on the same problem.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user is directed to previous issues and resources that might be helpful. 
* The issue remains open and unsolved as the conversation continues in the related thread.

**Problem:**

* Initial boot-up issue in the database.

**Proposed Solution:**

    * Missing `com.pieces.os\production\Pieces\couchbase.cblite2` folder due to a faulty installation process.

**Current Status:**

Application Crash on Startup
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Upon launching the application, it crashes immediately with an error message stating "Unexpected error occurred." This issue started occurring after updating to version 11.0.0. The crash seems to be related to the new plugin integration. Steps to reproduce:


## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation "Pieces App Crashing on macOS 12.3"

**Problem:**
- The Pieces app crashes when launched on macOS 12.3, despite working fine on previous version 10.9.5.

**Key points:**
- User provided detailed information about their operating system, hardware, installed plugins, and crash logs.
- User confirmed the problem was not the same as another reported issue.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**
- Support agent recommended checking a similar existing issue and suggested scheduling a support call.
- After investigation, the issue was identified as being resolved in the latest version 11.3.2.

**Current status/outcome:**
- The user is advised to update to version 11.3.2 and reopen the ticket if the issue persists.

**Additional notes:**
- The user's contribution helped identify and resolve the issue, improving the experience for other users.

recommendations: Prioritize resolving authentication issues impacting Pieces OS and Desktop App, focusing on account linking, login errors, and 500 errors on /os/sign_in. Investigate and address the root causes, such as the old authentication service and potential email case sensitivity issues.
Improve Pieces OS startup reliability by addressing database corruption, invalid ports, and native_extensions_plugin.dll crashes. Ensure consistent startup across Windows, macOS, and Linux platforms.

Provide clear documentation and troubleshooting steps for users experiencing startup or login issues, including verifying admin privileges during installation, using WinGet, and checking CPU compatibility (AVX2 support).
Investigate and resolve the Linux login issue causing 500 errors on /os/sign_in. Gather detailed logs and system information from affected users to identify the root cause.
Proactively monitor support logs and community forums for emerging issues and patterns. Implement measures to prevent similar issues from recurring in future releases.

Enhance communication with users experiencing issues, providing timely updates and estimated resolution times.  Consider offering alternative support channels like video calls for complex troubleshooting scenarios.
Improve error messaging and logging to provide more specific details about the cause of crashes and errors, facilitating faster diagnosis and resolution.
Develop automated tests to cover startup and login flows across different operating systems and configurations to catch regressions early in the development cycle.
Investigate the feasibility of a database recovery or repair tool to help users resolve corruption issues without requiring reinstallation.
Consider implementing a system to detect and alert users about potential compatibility issues, such as missing AVX2 support, before installation or upgrade to prevent startup failures.
